result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 22-CF-816 and 22-CM-206
Credit for 180 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No THC. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Probation and Parole to notify Court, in writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs. Comply with all doctors orders.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo

records.addlTxt: of Disposition of case
of DNA Collection at Conviction
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion count 3 is dismissed. Count one is amended. Amended criminal complaint filed. Attorney Koesser acknowledges receipt and waives reading. DE pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2. Court finds DE guilty of counts 1 and 2. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions; credit for 180 days served if revoked; concurrent to 22CF816 and 22CM206. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $400 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court. Bond applied. DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. During the plea colloquy the DE seemed to be having some trouble. DE's mother in court and states she does not believe the DE is thinking clearly.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke.  Attorney Koesser asks for a new date. Corresponding case should be transferred back to br 2 from br 6.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Due to a conflict in the court calendar the STC of 08/25/22 at 2:30 has been adjourned to 09/14/22 at 2:30.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State by zoom.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Koesser.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Koesser's bond motion. For reasons set forth on the record the bond motion is denied.
With Attorney Koesser a MH has been set to 07/08/22 at 10:30 on the Bond Motion.
to Reduce Bail

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant in custody by zoom w/Attorney  H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Koesser states he wants to look into behavioral health court for the deft. STC continued to 8/25/22 at 2:30pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Koesser.   Clerk. M.Burke. Atty Koesser asks for more time to see if DE can get into the Jail diversion program. STC set to 06/01/22 at 4:00.
filed by Atty. Hans Koesser  kmk
